iNVGIML3fCT8uTlBpounHw.text: LOVE the carnitas...quality and flavorful beef.. Reasonably priced.. and I am confident it was NOT horse meat... We ALL need to be careful of quality these days.. sometimes it pays to spend a few extra dollars on quality and trusting the brand.. IE Lettuce Entertain You..... also we enjoyed terrific service....

Js5RR1yyyTdpq45Bj-gGPw.text: Food was awesome. Service left a little to be desired. Waitress got my drink wrong as was extremely slow. Took forever to get guacamole, but it was worth the wait. Forgot to bring us waters after she offered to. Baja fish tacos and chicken nachos. Tacos better. Tasted tomatos salsa awesome. We ate out on the patio and had a niece view of foot traffic going up and down the strip.

mkEnZzPFaeaI8m-rlt6y3Q.text: *this is an update review. I received a call from their corporate office extending their apologies and send me a generous gift card to visit their restaurant again. About a year later we did & the entire visit was much better. Food was served hot, the order was consistent and we had a very nice and attentive waitress.  Thank you! We will visit again next time we are in Vegas.

zVb-lM2t5Jf4S3mni-AyEg.text: The chips and salsa and guacamole are great.  The music was loud and bad...caribbean/mexican hip-hop or something.  I'm suspect of a mexican restaurant that doesn't have chimichangas.  The chicken frijitas were nothing special.  Unimpressed with the margarita as well.

EPMi7NVFLcW-5J36yBWbzQ.text: Stumbled upon it when we were shopping at the Fashion Show Mall and are so glad we did! We were seated on the patio and the service was incredible. The server recommended a Blackberry Margarita that was just the perfect combination of tartness to balance the Tequila. Chips and salsa were hot and fresh, and the Carne Asada taco was one of my favorite meals ever. Don't miss this place!

wkoz91LAmG13PvKdlHoy8Q.text: Went here twice in a two day span. First time was to have a beer or two at the taco stand-sitting under the misters watching the Strip on a sunny day-can't be beat! Anyways, it smelled so good while we were there that we decided to go back for lunch the next day. I had a prickly pear margarita and the short rib tacos. Tacos were good, so were chips, salsa, and guacamole. The area under the trees is pretty and gives a nice shade on these hot summer days.

pkHiTacTGYsAjpTE7twj_Q.text: Awesome food with great flavors. Perfect portion size. Very nice seating inside and outside.

NDKuX6Ye9gvFLMU6qvcdWA.text: Super delish bottomless chips and salsa!!! You get three kinds of salsa to dip your tasty, salted chips into, and at only $2.95, you can't beat it!  The prices of their entrees and other appetizers are a bit over-priced.  The staff is super friendly, and the manager came by our table three times to ask if we needed anything...we'll definitely be back!

2t2n7RogVoa7xubpl9JgZQ.text: It's tucked away at the corner of Fashion Show mall. I celebrated my friends birthday here and the atmosphere is perfect for outdoor patio seating. You can people watch, it's lively and fun. There are candid lights hung around the trees, picturesque, similar to a cozy backyard. The inside is dark with intricate woodwork. There are two bars in the restaurant, one outside and one inside. The staff were extremely friendly, especially the server. They were very hands on and interactive even though we were a large group. Since we were a large group we ordered individually and I got to try a little bit of everything. They served the best guacamole I've ever had! It's not made tableside but it's made fresh and so flavorful. You have the option of choosing the spiciness level. I also had the steak fajitas which were good but the Shrimp tacos were superstars!!! Not to mention, the margaritas are a must-order especially if you are in a festive mood. I recommend coming here for a fun night out with friends and sitting outside on a warm summer night. If you can catch their happy hour that's even better. Ultimately, it's a little more on the pricey side but worth the celebration.

r09fvtJcT_d5U_cvvn5Vpw.text: The service here was great! Our waiter was very attentive. and was able to get us in and out with apps in under an hour! The food was pretty basic american mexican, but still tasted good. Not much spice. I really enjoyed the crab tostados. The enchiladas were predictable, but I did order enchiladas so I guess that is what I was looking for.  The portion sizes were very generous. and The rice was delicious!

7ik87saIhyUdgyWm8MsZCg.text: Happy hour special: $5 margs and $4 chips and salsa. This is about the best deal I found in Vegas. The margs were strong so it only takes a couple. I would love to get food here next time but the appetizers alone were great. I also loved the atmosphere! It was a little quiet in the restaurant, which was a nice break from the Strip, but they still have televisions in the bar area where it seemed to be busy. I plan on coming back on my next trip out!

d9K9ZtZZLnu8xHkDuc3j-w.text: Such a great atmosphere, unfortunately the nachos were not piled high with adequate toppings.  Totally should have ordered the table side guacamole.

eesbRB6TpTl9uym8qNo0dQ.text: Cheap drinks and food provide a nice break from the high priced surrounding casinos. Happy hour mune and drink specials daily. Friendly staff with quick service. Chips and salsa very tasty and some pretty sexy outifts on some of the waitstaff. Tv screens spread out pretty well if you're looking for a place to watch sports or get the night started.

dmK4ZhR2g7qGdQNrqSuEPg.text: A little bit of normaly in Sin City. Located across from the Wynn this is a great spot to getsome good food at understandable prices and not have to wait all night for a seat. Went twice on a recent trip and both times enjoyed the meal. They also have great salsa (3 different styles) with the usual table chips and nice Margaritas (not too tart like most). As a vegetarian I found some choices besides the std veggie quesadilla. Would be a 5 with a little better service and broader menu but would for sure recommend and go back again.

K23_MaMFNvUM9RCeH-qKkg.text: The only thing good about this place was the watermelon jalapeno margarita I had which was delicious.  Chips and salsa was good and it was free with the promo code.  Food was subpar, we had the steak fajitas.  The server we had was rude, but when I let the manager know he did rectify the situation.  I asked the server for the promo code (for the chips and salsa) and she told me I had to go back to the front door to find out what it was because she did not know it...but that was one of a few reasons the service was poor.  She also rushed me to make a decision.  Long story short, I would not recommend this place. Not so sure why there are so many great reviews about the food...possibly since I live in San Diego I have a higher standard for authentic Mexican food (but I should've known better lol).

ckM9XNYLkWCyjyc5hXPRuw.text: Happy hour was amazing- good food and lots of choice, lots of choice of drinks (we tried the sangria and fruit margaritas which were both yummy) and great pricing. We loved the fairy lights and the relaxed atmosphere too, would definitely come back again

5RzblmZr8nZ_d7oQMM9UmA.text: Not as good as I expected. However the nachos were fantastic!  Steak fajitas were alright too.

z5Lxb6G3qGhrEf6-TETxTA.text: Four stars for the food, five stars for the ambiance and service from Victor C. The chips and salsa can definitely be ordered as a stand alone meal, perfectly yummy and flavorful.   The nighttime ambiance enchants with the firefly lights and the Strip's magic. The food is spot on whether you're craving enchiladas or salads, but the real stars go to our server. He was attentive and genuinely friendly towards Mom and me. Answered our questions without treating us like idiots. A True treat!

E_9fvvZPS6As1nuVHVhObA.text: Out of the whole weekend trip in Vegas, I enjoyed this meal the most. Everything was delicious from beginning to end. Chips and salsa come with 3 different salsa that are all so freaking good it's hard to stop eating but trust me you must force yourself to save room for an elote. So so good. Must order. Entrees were amazing as well. Fajitas, chicken enchiladas, and braised pork tacos were all so satisfying. Price was not bad at all. Dessert menu is lacking but you can get dessert anywhere. Definitely recommend when you're craving some Mexican food in Vegas.

biAOIbB0t6KokwV3wk0MeA.text: Decided to drop into this establishment to grab a quick lunch rather than opt for the Fashion Show Mall food court. $126 later for a party of 5, I was left wondering WHY when it didn't seem that we ordered that much food.  When I checked my receipt a few hours later, I realized that the server had not only automatically charged us the "mandatory 18% for a party of 5," but she did it TWICE. First, it's not that much $ and I have spent much more money on a meal for 2 at some fine restaurants around the world - BUT, I was caught off guard that a party of 5 had a mandatory service charge.  I honestly would have tipped more but the rebel in me doesn't like to be told I have to do something.  Larger parties, I totally understand. But, for 5?  I consider that tacky and wouldn't be surprised if this results in smaller tips for the servers overall.  Food was good. Above average mexican food - an elevated version of El Torito.   I will give credit to the manager who fixed the issue with the double service charge once I called to inquire (after basically implying I could have been under the influence.) Now, had I had an ounce of alcohol all week and this was not a work lunch, I probably would have laugh about it - but, it was a presumptuous remark - and somewhat insulting. She fixed it nonetheless, so thank you.  I only called because I was bored waiting for my delayed flight at the airport.  If I were busy as usual, I would have let it go and took the loss and this place could carry on with it's shady business.  Beware - I don't think I am the only person this has happened to. The waitress didn't even bat an eye.  In fact, the charges were labeled as two separate types of services so it would have been confusing and misleading to anyone. BAD BUSINESS.   Eat here if you're at Fashion Show Mall.  Eat here if you are craving Mexican food, but something better than the Chipotle inside the mall. Eat here if you're okay paying $19.99 for chicken tacos. (Note: chicken tortilla soup is AWESOME!) Eat here if you want to be forced into 36% of your total check.  Two stars for the soup. Another star added for the effort the general manager and partner put into fixing the issue. I will return for sure and hope to provide a 4-5 star rating as this place has some real potential.

y4P8uhAY0FWBFdS1KYLpyg.text: Loved it here amazing Mexican food, amazing drinks, fair pricing. I had the fish tacos, guac, and salsa bottomless chip app. They were all amazing. We also had a mango margarita and red wine sangria, which was nice. I liked the margarita not so much the sangria. Will definitely recommend. Beautiful outdoor ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing fish tacos.
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guac, salsa, mango margarita, &amp; sangria

xneJbgVANUGFUadJsG9brw.text: Had the Mahi Fajitas and they were awesome. Guac was excellent, location was good.

7Uzyl4yqWgyIN0DJ9Dpf2g.text: If you are in Las Vegas please make sure and visit this awesome place!!! Its soooo good you wont be disappointed!!!  Guacamole = amazing chips = amazing margaritas = amazing  tacos=amazing

wpj8Qdpd3oK8q1Ph4JKcLA.text: We had made reservation and arrived early.  We were seated immediately and within minutes had our drink orders taken.  The staff were wonderfully attentive but not over bearing. The margaritas were amazing and we loved the green salsa that came with the chips.  My husband had steak fajitas and I had mahi mahi tacos.  Both were fantastic and the portion sizes were great!  We would definite go back on another trip to Vegas.

goG-HjqSeCHglcsIyF_Dlg.text: This is our new favorite place! We were staying at the Wynn across this street and saw this place while walking around. So glad we stopped in! We sat at the bar and ordered guacamole and carne asada tacos, and of course drinks! Service was quick, the bartenders were excellent and the food was good! The homemade guacamole was delicious, the carne asada was okay, the steak was a bit too tough for me. I would probably try the chicken next time. But the rice and beans on the side were perfection. The best part about this place for us was the ambiance at the outside bar area. The outdoor lights and seating was perfect to enjoy a cold drink and people watch. Can't wait to go back!!

kaQ0DVmICI1dM7r7FIugOw.text: Amazing service!!! Good music! Cold beer!! Delicious guacamole  the food was pretty good!! I ordered the carne asada tacos

nrPSUzP84g5k6W5_bR6pcQ.text: I am a Las Vegas local that is an avid "foodie" and also a Vegas Golden Knights fan. On Sunday, October 28th I thought I'd try a new restaurant and watch the Golden Knights game at 5:00p. Since the World Series was on during the time that the Knights game was on, I figured I'd call ahead before driving from Summerlin to the strip to this restaurant. I called about 3:30p to verify that El Segundo Sol would be showing the Knights game since I was told by a friend that they had several TVs and two bar areas. A friendly gentlemen answered the phone and he told me that they would be showing "both" games and he'd see me in a bit!!  Fabulous I thought to myself! I texted my friend and she agreed to meet me down there. When I got to the restaurant a little after 5:00p, I did not see the Knights game on any TV. I asked the hostess and she replied that they were showing the World Series. I asked if maybe the bartender could change one tv and she quickly offered that I speak to the manager.  When the manager came and I explained that I drove down there to try out the restaurant and watch the Knights game and was SPECIFICALLY told on the phone at 3:30p that the game would be shown there, he did not seem to care. He simply stated they were showing the World Series. I asked if he could just change ONE tv and he said NO. He didn't really seem to care that someone on his staff told me they would have both games on. I am in management/customer service as well and I know that he could have made that situation right, had he wanted to or cared. Shame on you for not doing the right thing for a local customer!! And shame on you for not supporting your local NHL hockey team by showing the game on just ONE of several TVs. My friend and I left and will not be returning.

PrOaqUdf5DmxJ_0sWQZpcg.text: We were there on a Travel Zoo offer ~ we have dined here before so we were familiar with the decor which is casual with a lot of ambiance & a menu which isn't pages & pages & pages & pages. We obviously like El Segundo Sol since we have a lot of choices when it comes to Mexican restaurants in the Las Vegas/Henderson area.    Our server was GREAT! her name was Travina (sp?) very pleasant and she had NO attitude because the use of the Travel Zoo coupon/offer. she was a delight will ask for her section on our next visit~   We started with margaritas & guacamole/chips. The guac was a VERY generous portion for 2 people and tasted outta sight!!! I ordered the chicken enchiladas (2 per order) with green sauce and they were the BEST I have EVER eaten, REALLY!! the shredded chicken was still moist & the green sauce had a bit of citrus in it and wasn't overly spicy...all just devine. I would be hard pressed not to order this same item again.    No dessert as we were quite satisfied, and this was only lunch time so a walk around Fashion Show Mall for a little exercise was next on OUR menu.

C9CsDIvDxbAY9kmw1QKgAA.text: Our favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas. They have the best prickly pear margaritas and fabulous white sangria. Awesome happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this place!

nEP3Tun1OeCalFhlgUS-cg.text: Small portions but overall food was good and seasoned well. They'll give you loads of veggies but NO Meat!

qwEiTaUyMrhdlHPjUJcIww.text: First time and it was great! Jose has amazing customer service and the food was delicious. So if your looking for some Mexican food, then this is the right place to go. The Carne Asada plate is the best. It's definitely a 5 Star.

H371H0Cu-PIPZ9CFsiGNaQ.text: Came in for some enchiladas and margaritas and we had a very friendly server BOWDIE thanks buddy haD a nice table looking out at this Vegas Strip one of my favorite Mexican places in Las Vegas I'll definitely be back.  My only complaint is I hate paying for chips and salsa almost gave a four-star just because it pisses me off  Back again for the 20th time.   Z was a great server.   I f omg love this place.  I always get the fajitas

MSwCoPd3V3U7vUL_c1qR2g.text: Amazing food came and got some steak fajitas and a margarita and wow! Yummy perfect little spot kinda tricky to find it's behind the escalator def worth of.

MqnzN-WIWvZnH0ZahlSJzg.text: This place is awesome....... the server was very helpful and he always checked on us just the simply fact of him explaining cook times let's us know he cared about his job. The food was great came out fast I will come back here anytime I am in town.

CNSg1SGUosiswN1vnybwQA.text: Found this place on the find me Gluten free app as I am coeliac.  Great friendly service from Ericka, portion sizes and gluten free options all marked clearly on the menu.  Would recommend as a great alternative to overpriced strip restaurants.

rQ5TQH7F6w7MQ5f-mZQvLQ.text: Fell in love with the margarita our amazing bartender made for us.  Then the manager talked to us about different types of tequila and we tried a couple.  I haven't experienced this kind of hospitality in Vegas to date.   I will return.  Went back next day for happy hour.  3$ tacos and the pork belly are the bomb.  Manager and everyone extremely friendly and happy.  Highly recommend !

1kUAqSv-JRckVakxtz6iGg.text: The cucumber mint  margarita is a must! Also tried the frozen Moscow mule it was average. The guacomle table side  perfect spice.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dKVVYAYXb_uXaTHDn36kAg.text: Margarita of the day: 4 stars (hubby really liked it) Carne Asada taco platter: 5 stars. Comes with rice (savory with herbs-maybe cilantro), beans, pick de gallo, sour cream and grilled and season Asada. 5 tortilla served on the side.  Ahi tuna ceviche: 4 stars. Well done with completely cooked ahi tuna ( they were in small chunks.) with rice on the bottom, cucumbers, radish strips and ciltantro. I would have liked a little more cilantro. It came with saltine and tortilla Guacamole: 5 stars. comes in mild, medium,  hot. We got the mild because hubby doesn't like spicy. And I couldn't taste any spicy at all. They make the guacamole fresh and it tasted fresh and delicious with just a hint of lime juice.  Rated 4.5 stars for food and round up to 5 stars for the great service!!

92Sbqeau6JpTsk9_61ZhMQ.text: We went to El Segundo last night (Friday) for their Happy Hour. We found the staff to be very welcoming and the service was excellent. My wife would like to highlight the prickly pear margarita. We enjoyed the pork belly, braised pork and chipotle steak street tacos. They were all excellent, I simply preferred the steak. It had a little char on it with the sweetness of some pineapple - it was excellent. It took a while for our tacos to arrive, yet we were enjoying the drinks and beautiful evening. The chips (my preference) are a bit too hard but the three salsa's were quite good. We look forward to returning.

19tPxK-v9EPc6lfb6_2PqA.text: Great options for carnivores and veggie lovers alike. Ahhhmazing atmosphere and the food was delicious. Table side guacamole is a must and go for the spicy!

mlVJ-71lgawXKhbpGL7jtw.text: This place is a good time, happy hour is 4-7 and that's the only time you can get the street taco that everyone talks about on here. Everyone in my table got the en salada which was very tasty! The dressing was amazing, super light but filling. It has more than listed on the menu it has lots of avocado, chicken, corn salsa, tortilla strips. It's good for the price and it's light if you don't wanna look too chubby before you step out

kgLlWJpP6nHDy3UKQa231Q.text: This place is amazing! The chicken tacos were phenomenal! Whatever is in their secret recipe for the small corn tortillas is gold! Also, their salsa and guacamole were fantastic. Service was great, food was great, will definitely be returning.

42QXGl6p3dmeT9CGuRaJLA.text: Stopped in here for a quick bite and drinks. Good lil outside casual bar feel. Service was fast, and the view was good. Went with the chicken taquitos with some sour cream...yum! We also got nachos with all the fixings.   Good, but it was a couple bucks overpriced I thought. I got three taquitos for $10, which seems a lil steep I think.   Good place to stop in for a bite if you're on that side of the Vegas strip.

gBGKcP51TtmxVeP-EDPKew.text: Kinda Pricey but great food. A large Margarita is 20 dollar and in a cheap plastic souvenir cup. Not too much food options but over all it's a great place however since it's a place that is kind of a shared space out doors I asked to sit inside where there is AC cause Vegas is so hot but even the inside is hot cause it's a very open place so it was a little uncomfortable to eat in the heat.

o-zamfFHc3-IedIdVxUgTQ.text: Came here for dinner and it was packed, had to sit by the bar  Pros: - Loved the atmosphere, very fun and inviting - Loved the beef quesadillas and chicken fajitas (everything was so good) - Large portion sizes - chicken fajitas came with bunch of flour tortillas and chicken/onions/peppers - loved the added grilled tomatoes    Cons: - None!

I7VDdIaPqMaVAVS9bsnUnw.text: If your a local this place is hands down the best mexican happy hour spot you'll find! Its on the strip so you gotta deal with that but free parking and if you park in the garage under neath. $3 tacos, $5 margaritas, nachos are great and tasty!!

7j84sDrXamnnE5UfoXNLlA.text: Great service.  We went during happy hour and got $15 pitcher of sangria and $3 street tacos. All the food came out tasting great. Stellar service. We sat in the bar and they had heaters going for the cooler weather out.

txqz4x1slnxfZinU2MJ1EA.text: El Segundo Sol has amazing food and great service. I've never tasted Mexican food that is so authentic and made from notably quality ingredients. The handmade tortillas are really good too. I love the Mahi Mahi tacos.   This is my new go-to spot in Vegas. If you like good tacos and margaritas, this is the spot.

ea4hfBpx4wl5FyvIgLibbA.text: Honestly best bar service we have gotten in Las Vegas so far! Chris was fantastic! He went above and veyind with us and what a conversation. Bartenders like that are worth keeping. I loved the food and the beef on the nachos has the perfect mexican seasoning.  P.S. THE SALSAS WERE NOT SPICY! Even the chipotle was less than mild. Get something spicy for a mexican Restaurant!  Again. 5 stars to Chris!

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VG1mJMlCDLsd1BISJyUdxA.text: We typically don't frequent Mexican restaurants but this was close to our hotel and their yelp photos looked so good! We came by on a Saturday night and received amazing service! I wish I caught our servers name. We sat on the patio and wow it's beautiful out there! They have the heat lamps going so you won't feel the cold dry outside air hahaha.   We started off with two margaritas. The aperol and the prickly pear. They have three different sizes. We wanted our meal to be more food centric and just got small sizes. The drinks were delish! Prickly pear is a bit sweeter for those that don't like a strong tequila taste.   For food we shared the chicken tinga nachos and the vegetarian tacos. We mentioned to our server we like things really spicy and she even brought out some habanero sauce for us. It wasn't super spicy but the flavor was sooooo good. The nachos were honestly the best I've ever had. The pickled and raw jalapeno really sold me!   The tacos were good as well. Who knew asparagus, bell peppers, and squash can work in tacos? I was reluctant but it was yummy and the portions were huge. We had MORE than enough for the two of us!   Thanks to our server for making our first night in Vegas so hospitable!

B2Eqcu-YWq5xA7sNAqx9bA.text: Such a beautiful restaurant and excellent dining experience. A reservation was made for a group of friends and I, and despite arriving before the time of our scheduled reservation, the staff was very accommodating and service was spectacular. I ordered the Baja fish tacos. It's a diy taco, and they give you all the fixings. The Mahi Mahi was superb quality, breaded and fried to perfection. The guacamole was my favorite I've had by far, if you can handle it, be sure to order it spicy! They give you plenty to share among 4-5 people along with a side of bottomless chips. Highly recommend this place, be sure to also come during happy hour as well! I'll be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja Fish Tacos

HYR4gaDEJQpYstrfCp-2rA.text: We just touched down in Vegas and decided to take a walk and look around. We stayed at the Palazzo and saw this restaurant strip area across the street from the Wynn hotel. It's located in the fashion show mall-there's a big sign in the front.  Lots of different places to choose to eat at but glad we chose this place. The restaurant is an  indoor/outdoor open setting. Very chill and relaxed feel.  We ordered the slow cook braised pork tacos.  They were so tender and so delish. We really enjoyed it.  The tacos came with caramelized Pineapple, Guajillo Chiles, Cilantro. The mix between all the ingredients were heavenly.  They have happy hour times too if you're interested in hanging out at their bar and grabbing a few drink. They had a special where you can buy 5 beers for $45.   Nice place. Glad we picked it.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wish they had this little notification when I was a server! Lol

Lyzvh7oBLUaFN5MBzKrQEg.text: What I ordered: grilled steak fajita/ coconut flan /margarita  Date: 4/2019 First time: yes   This place would've had a 5 start but the rude host left a bad impression. I walked up to the stand asked the host how long the wait for 2 was. The look on her face wAs as if she didn't have time to answer my question at the moment & she barely acknowledged me because she was so concerned on counting tables or something. Then she looked straight at me and asked if I can hold because she has to seat the big party first.  I didn't ask to be seated I just asked how long the wait was.. Anyway, the food did not disappoint & the margaritas were delicious. The music made our time there more enjoyable as well. The coconut flan is to die for!

c5UlJceBNINakvS_Th6TxA.text: Stopped in for happy hour after checking out the Erotica Museum across the street. This place is beyond cute, the decor is just amazing, is spacious and welcoming. We sat at the bar for happy hour and margaritas were around $5.50 which is great.  I ordered the frozen mango margarita and the classic, they were both good. Just the right amount of mango and tequila, not overpowering at all. They also had food on the happy hour menu, I ended up getting one order of beef tacos($3) and a beef quesadilla ($6). They were a little busy so the wait for the food was a tad bit long, but not too much.  Now be careful when it comes to the food special for happy hour. The taco is small and you only get one for the price, but is so delicious you'll end up ordering at least 3. My beef taco was very delicious and the quesadilla was good too, wish it had more meat inside.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e_CRJCLWSNwyCFrrwHtm9Q.text: The service is amazing. Just amazing. Wow! Homemade tortillas, amazing salsas. I did not expect this, but was pleasantly surprised. Try the cucumber margarita and ask for the "secret" hot salsas.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rh1z4Oyo4hI9vbM-sDpI_Q.text: Don't let the reviews fool you this is like a chain of very over priced mediocre Mexican food.  Also the drinks.  Tourist trap.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NTK-KL-8erZOLVGDRLRsVQ.text: Where do I start!!!!! We seat ourselves in the bar area and as we are walking towards our table the guacamole station is wide open and mind you the place is on a patio BUT not only that the waitress' make the guacamole which I was watching make (unbeknownst to the waitress) and she was not wearing any gloves and not only that she went to put her fingers in her mouth to take the gum out that she was chewing but decided to just spit it out into the hole of the cart that they make the guacamole on!!!! Needless to say I will not be back plus the chips, salsa and guacamole tastes better at Chili's and I am a guacamole fanatic!!!

HuzCuICleW2Rq57sDJrr4g.text: A must try in Vegas. Awesome Mexican food. The Hotels, the casinos, the shows, the crowd and all the fun.. and el Segundo Sol... That's Vegas for me.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4zfDm2QZ1oKX8tgGkl6M1Q.text: We were looking for a good Mexican dinner during our stay in Vegas. We wanted to go to Diego's at the MGM, but just found out it closed. Last trip to Vegas, we went to Javier's at the Aria. It was good, but not good enough to warrant a return considering the many options available in Vegas.   El Segundo Sol is definitely worth a return. It's casual with indoor/outdoor seating in the Fashion Show Place Mall.  For us, one of the big deals was that they had a HUGE gluten free menu. Tons upon tons of options, which is so important. And the server knew enough about their gluten free practices to make us feel comfortable.  We started with their very good guacamole. You are able to select mild, moderate, or spicy. It comes with endless chips and salsa. Honestly, this is pretty much all I needed to eat because it was so good and I was full when it was done!  Husband and I split a combination chicken and shrimp fajita platter. It was excellent. Everything was so tasty. It was seasoned just right and all of the sides included were fresh and added to the flavor.  The waitress was great too. She was very sweet and recommended good drinks (for us the blackberry margarita was a perfect choice).  Overall fantastic choice that was a nice cheat meal for my normally very clean diet. It's always a bummer when you take a cheat meal and it ends up being not worth it. This one, DEFINITELY worth it.

qCU8zHN17hEhodUmstscJA.text: Food is great! price is good! drinks are cheap!  What more can you ask for?   The best baja fish tacos I've ever had! yummm!

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja fish tacos.. Im in love

MFFm7mZsMJlT1TRdCC_cyA.text: Guacamole. Really REALLY good, made to order guacamole. That's all that needs to be said.  But, I will say a little more.  Start off with an awesome margarita, I loved the blackberry! Try (and this won't be easy) to not gorge yourself on the chips and guacamole, not to mention that the salsa is pretty dang good too and the chips are hot, crispy and corny. If you have not filled yourself to the brim with guac I recommend the sweet corn tamales.  I have been looking for some of these tasty little gems for a couple of years now since my favorite place closed and these come as close as I have had. These are just stinking good.  I am full, I am happy, I wish my stomach could hold more of this goodness.  Thanks El Segundo.

kTEHwFfFlIk_cQOQDeiW3w.text: Funny that after all these years visting Las Vegas I had never been here before. My friend YM from Lyon France suggested it. They have a killer happy hour with excellent margaritas and really cheap eats. The 3$ tacos looked excellent.   We had dinner the night we were there and the guacamole was worth the extra $$ its fantastic. All the food was great and the portions were huge. El Segundo is an oasis of value and excellent service in a sea of overpriced casino restaurants add it to your list next time your in LV.

eNJnRoHdxtMCBsYBKWNrkQ.text: We were in Las Vegas last week, celebrating our anniversary. Since we were staying at the Wynn right across the street, we decided to enjoy a late-night dinner at Segundo Sol. (late for us is 9:00; we usually eat at 5!)    We got a table in front of the patio.  A very friendly waitress came over promptly to take our drink order. I had a michelada in the big 32 oz. cup. K'ayum asked for a suicide (all soft drinks mixed together) and they were happy to oblige. Adriana had a prickly pear margarita. She said it was great.  For starters, we ordered the queso fundido and the grilled peppers. K'ayum ordered chicken taquitos. The queso fundido blew us away - it was amazing! It came with chips and hand-made tortillas. The grilled peppers were interesting - a plate of green peppers (and one red one) with lime and salt. They were quite tasty and not too spicy, until we got to the red one. There should be a warning label on it!    K'ayum wasn't too happy with the taquitos because they had cheese inside, so we helped him - amazing!  And from the kid's menu!   The waitress came by to check on us, and we decided we were too full to order anything else. I asked for the tequila list, and she recommended one of my favorite anejos - Reserva de la Familia - but I opted for Clase Azul (the reposado - I've only seen the anejo at one bar)  (Javier's at the Aria - $200 a shot...)  Although the food and service were both great, it was the michelada that did it for me. I came back the next morning at opening right before leaving for the airport to have one more at the bar, to see how it's made.  They put the usual: clamato, lime, pepper, worcestershire sauce - the big difference as far as I could see was cayenne pepper! So I've been making them that way at home ever since - and using my Segundo Sol cup (you get to keep the 32 oz. one...) to pretend that I'm still there!

IA0X16jkb6cI25m2PhRaHg.text: This Mexican restaurant is right on the strip outside of the Fashion Show Mall. It was our first time here and we really enjoyed it. We all ordered the chicken fajitas and they were very very good! The sides of rice and beans were excellent as well. We ordered an appetizer of some sort of cheese dip with chips and loved it. The prices weren't too bad, around $20 per person. I would highly recommend it if you are close to the mall. Give it a try!

RuZSc8tJcxRwpG_qxV7lng.text: I have been here a few times before.  By now I know I just really come for the guacamole and margaritas. Their made to order, how you like it guacamole is sooo good. It's enough for an appetizer for 4 or really good to pick at with their chips and salsa (complimentary) while drinking. My favorite margaritas are the cucumber mint which is very refreshing, or the pitaya ( cactus) tangy and a little sweet.  The food and service has fallen short for me too many times.  But I love the guacamole, drinks,  and atmosphere.  Plus there's decent people watching and it's conveniently located outside the mall.

iqCDi71YdhQXV0DyE4RYCA.text: Definitely a must come back place food was delicious and customer service is great the atmosphere was awesome the server great shoutout to Jose will definitely come back

NK5aM8ASMlQgCc6FPg9U_w.text: Ate there last night, the food was really good and I specially loved the presentation of the fajitas, was unique. Our server was such a sweet heart. The only compliant was the variety of deserts, no churros and the tres leeches was not that good.

0mqrJc9taQZYOfCIqVe-DA.text: They have the best watermelon peach margarita! Their fresh guacamole was to die for and their corn was amazing as well.

A1y7z65cIiplWEPuLcDsjw.text: Well I'm in Vegas and I guess this is what you got to expect. Went to try some Mexican food out.  I had the pork tacos with no flavor and I supposed to have pineapple one chunk pineapple and no pineapple flavor like pastor. Very small portions of rice and beans and pork. Had a margarita not much to say about that the beer was better.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HBEDZGCutOkuto2QkQdp8A.text: Absolutely incredible. Amazing tacos and great presentation. The outside environment is very welcoming and chill. Great place to go if you want some good food and are willing to spend some money, great bang for your buck

X-WMozWLpUl53YXt5ovv5g.text: great food, great service! I definitely will be coming back here on my next visit to Las Vegas.

WkKcYqU_jn2OiPNypznfBw.text: First of all this place has a great patio with The Strip views and lots of foliage. We ordered the Brisket soup and chicken fajitas. Both were the excellent. They do not give out complimentary tortilla chips and salsa. They offer an unlimited order for $5. This would be fine for a table of four or more. My only suggestion after one time eating there is that they offer a smaller order of chips for a table for two. Will definitely be back though.

Xw94WuQLkx7rRc9lTO71vg.text: I'm just here to chime in about El Segundo Sol's strip-side taco "shack". Nestled in close to El Segundo Sol  and Stripburger (both Lettuce Entertain You Restaurants), this could have huge potential as a great place for a little (very little) snack.  These are the tiny, and very authentically sized, tacos like you find on the streets of Mexico, unfortunately they are $3 each.  They come in three flavors, beef, pork and chicken. If you want more dressing up than a little pico de gallo and a wedge of lime (which is the "traditional" way), it was cost you another 90-cents or so for some lettuce, onion, tomato and avocado (as I recall, I did not go for the upgrade).   What brought us in was the 2-for-1 coupons being handed out on the sidewalk. This was the only kind of card I wanted to grab, and as it turned out, it was a decent and tasty deal.  I just can't over the price of the tacos, or the beer (a bucket of mini-Coronas for twenty-plus dollars).   Other than price (it is Lost Wages after all) the tacos were quite tasty, just keep an eye out for those coupons.  PS. The Yelp map is off for this location. El Segundo Sol is at the NE corner of the Fashion Show mall (Las Vegas Blvd. S and Dio Dr.), right next door to Stripburger.  Edit: I just noticed that the "South" is missing from the address and edited the business info. That will probably fix the map.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My brother and me (too bad we are blocking the prices).
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dad, with that pricey bucket of Coronas.

xsf6Ep8icobigjRBXYZRyA.text: Ordered bottomless chips, carne asada tacos and nachos for lunch.  Tasted good.  A bit pricey...$60 incl tip but, hey, its in strip in fashion show.  Server was attentive, atmosphere was good.  We were seated promptly.

tQ1sOjeTKhW4qb4lB99aqQ.text: We started with chips and guac.  It was tops.  Warm freshly made chips cooked dark and with the right amount of salt.  Three salsa styles: rojo, tomatillo and fresca, all of which were well made.  Frozen machine margs were the right mix of sweet, tart, cold and plenty strong (unlike most machine margs).  The margs are what took it from 4 to 5 stars.  Fish tacos with house made corn tortillas, also tops.  Great tortillas, properly cooked and spiced grilled fish, nice sides and condiments.  Cold crab mini tostada appetizers were also good.  Great service and seating options.  I'm hard pressed to complain about any part of my experience at El Segudo Sol.

i_6d0G_ytPF4PxOVBH_6TQ.text: Third time is NOT the charm. Before starting a shopping spree, my best friend & I dropped in for some sustenance. We sat in the bar so we could partake in the happy hour menu (smaller portions, 4-7p, served in the bar only). This was after the hostess was nowhere to be found. Our waitress took my friend's margarita order, walked a couple yards to the bar then brought the wrong flavor. Then we ordered "2 chicken quesadillas & 2 chicken street tacos". Easy! Yet, somehow, we didn't get everything we ordered. Strike 2. Strike 3? Did I see our waitress roll her eyes!? Quite frankly, we should have eaten at the Chipotle inside the Fashion Show Mall. Their food, service & guacamole are much better.

qEpy-mz0TgO1C5JRRFkQbw.text: I've been here multiple times. The food is consistently good. Always fresh. The tableside guacamole is a must have. The price has gone up from years past but still very good for the Las Vegas strip.

SxBp61WuNwTeC4ccEUMmBA.text: Although we were sad to see that our favorite spanish restaurant closed, El Segundo ended up being a nice surprise. They guac is prepared table side and was excellent. Everyone enjoyed our food.

r5Ix93x7cT3A6wKRw4wSEg.text: stopped in here yesterday late afternoon for a little happy hour treat. after we were seated in the bar by the hostess nobody came over to take our order. almost 10 - 15 minutes later the hostess came by again and asked if anyone came by for drinks and when we said no she brought somebody over. i didn't catch our waiters name but he took our drink order along with a side of chicken nachos and gave us some water. the glasses that were brought over were really warm though. no ice water was served here. i could tell my boyfriend was a little displeased. After being thirsty for an hour of mall walking i know he wanted some nice, cold water. he was pleased they had one of his favorite beers though, modelo especial. i ordered a frozen prickly pear margarita ($4.95) while Dan T. ordered his beer. Another 10 minutes went by before we got our drinks. Dan enjoyed his beer and my margarita was refreshing. A little too sweet but it is the first margarita i have had in months so i shouldn't complain. i recommend the prickly pear to the ladies and gents who prefer to not taste their alcohol. i had no idea i was getting anything. about another 10 - 15 minutes passed before we got our nachos. they didn't warn us the plate was burning hot so my hand almost melted when i touched it grabbing some nachos. OW! they weren't bad. i wish the bottom part didn't consist of 8 nachos turned one because of melted cheese. the guacamole and tomatos were not spread out, but one of each on the side. weird. i do wish they were all over and messy though. it mostly consisted of melted cheese and chicken. the meat wasn't bad, but it should have had a little more flavor to it. I don't know if i will be back. wasn't awful and disgusting, but nothing really made me say wow between the drink and the nachos. it was sunday from 4 to 5pm and the place wasn't packed at all so the fact that nobody came by for a while at first annoyed me. i had such better hopes for this place. oh well. i'll stick to dos caminos if i am over in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. prickly pear margarita

tLGcpno8-a_CGtQJf77rPg.text: I thought it was ok but nothing spectacular.  The service was good, went during lunch hours.  The guacamole was homemade but it was very average.

rTFqZFN4id38lCGxyOOnlg.text: Recently had a late lunch at El Segundo Sol. Being a native Californian now living in NY, I was impressed with the freshness and the flavors of  everything I tried. From the chips with three salsa's (I'm still craving the delicious green salsa) to the awesome Baja fish tacos and the super fresh ceviche ( the market fish of the day was a yummy Tuna),  Also enjoyed a bright pink Prickly Pear Margarita which was worth the teasing from my lunch mate.  Definitely coming back on my next trip.

4wR_JCWArEio6kqOQpC2uQ.text: I would come back just for the brisket tacos...nuff said =)

MhCZhsc8mdJ-REE9eyjhqA.text: My boyfriend and I came in recently for date night after hearing plenty about it from friends. Food was awesome and generously portioned. Full bar so I took advantage but my boyfriend doesn't drink so he ordered a virgin margarita.. absolutely delicious without that syrup-like taste that other places usually have. Showed up early for our reservation and were seated right away, definitely a plus considering that almost never happens on the strip. Staff was super nice and even though it was busy, we didn't feel rushed at all which was great. Overall an awesome experience. We'll be sure to come back again next time we're craving mexican food on date night :)

RU0uhCTNKgiiSjxf9ApbtQ.text: Delicious! The happy hour menu is a goodie, cheap taco's and yummy sangria. The unlimited 3 salsa's and taco chips is by far the best snack ! Can't go wrong.

ZpiRVPv1eisCuVdub51MIQ.text: Pros: +Good food +Cool atmosphere  +Decent happy hour, especially for a weekend +On the strip  Cons: -Poor service (took 20 minutes for someone to come take our order)  Overall: Good restaurant - I'll be going back.

uHsNpltkSc77i8kAAIlcYw.text: My fiancee & I decided to have lunch there this Saturday. We arrived & sat at the bar area. Our table was dirty & the bus boy never came to clean. The bartender cleaned up for us & took our drink order. Our server never came to take our order. We asked the hostess & her reply was "I have no idea who your server is" . When our server came he asked us to go ahead & keep ordering from the bartender since we already got drinks from him. We go to Las Vegas several times a year and I will never go back to this place. Such a shame because we were really looking forward to trying the food.

Pz0vyBNI6o1h_-vD5AqcSg.text: Sat at the bar. Great bartender. I had chicken taquitos. Cant remember the drink I had. But everything was good. Will return and try an entree.

Dbe7kuTKezsSUzapH0P-Yw.text: This place was just a waste of time & money. First of all, it's another americanized restaurant serving unoriginal "mexican" food. Food is alright, nothing special. Margaritas are weak. I ordered a large margarita with a double shot. When the waitress brought it out it was really small in size, and tasted like pure margarita mix. Customer service is horrible. All servers I encountered were rude.    I ordered the bottomless chips & salsa. They brought out one half empty basket of chips & 1 salsa. I politely told the waitress that I had ordered the bottomless chips with the 3 salsas. She then rolled her eyes and snatched the basket from my table and mumbled a "sorry". 10 minutes later, (still no chips & salsa)  a different waitress comes by and rudely drops a bowl of guacamole, and then walks away. I tried to get her attention before she walked away but she literally just dropped it and took off. Was everyone having a bad day? A few minutes later my original waitress came by and I explained to her what happened, she was half listening and looking in some other direction and just said..  "Oh,...well ok, so you don't want the guacamole?" "No, I never ordered it, but I'm still waiting on my bottomless chips" She picks up the guacamole rolls her eyes and walks away. WTF. I didn't even say it rude or anything. I said it in the sweetest voice I could. I've seen the movie "waiting", I was too scared to piss her off, then later find a loogie in my food. So I let it go.  I finally ordered my food and my super weak margarita. Waited for almost 25 minutes before getting my food. It wasn't even busy! There were maybe three other tables besides mine. By now my patience was wearing thin. I just wanted to eat my crappy expensive food and get out of there. I ate as quickly as possible.  I asked for my check, and again waited a pretty long while. I saw my waitress just standing there chatting with another co-worker, at this time, I've had it. So I went up to the waitress and told her I've been waiting way too long and I needed to go NOW. She handed me the check, and of course she had charged me for the guacamole. I told her...she said she'll fix it.... then she disappeared, and I had to wait 10 more minutes! I don't think I've ever spent this much time in a restaurant trying to "get out". I felt like a hostage. I was just sitting there on an empty table, w/ my doggy bag in my hands. Finally she got back, and I rudely snatched the receipt out of her hands and stormed out.  I can honestly say I'm never going back to that hell hole. The staff needs a serious attitude makeover. They're lucky they got two stars. 1 star for the location and 1 star for the huge and not so bad tasting quesadilla.

A5yCNP5n-TuqQwLxbbrYfA.text: Horrible drinks. Manager could tell we were not happy with our drinks fixed only one. Food needs help. Bartender had a bad attitude. Server was amazingl. Great tacos at take out bar

1UOX7zATP_7ZLebGeRSQ-A.text: It was our first time in vegas in this restaurant the food was the best i have ever had and their margaritas the best. the deserts are delicious.

OVeOEWlsCOo7qcYpuo8KVQ.text: Surprisingly awesome! Visited this restaurant during lunch and the service was fast and friendly. Sat at the bar and ordered the braised beef tacos and they were amazing. Fresh corn tortillas, rice, flavorful beans and delicious salsa help you create the perfect marriage of taste and texture in every bite. I'll definitely try this place again!

PuDVvF9m0iKRrZAaPbG7lQ.text: My sons 30th birthday party dinner at El Segundo Sol was Excellent!!   The event planner Natalie that  coordinated the party was professional, well organized and on top of all of our needs.  The servers, Taylor and Alfonso and the rest of the El Segundo Sol team that took care of us didn't miss a beat!   We had our party in the El Medio room which was great for our loud group of 30 Aunts, Uncles and Cousins.  Our group menu  included a great beverage package (beer, white and red sangria, house margaritas, and non-alcoholic beverages) and a great Fajita dinner package (awesome starters, home made guacamole, chips, salsa, Padrone peppers and coarse salt , great tasting chipotle salad, delicious chicken and beef fajitas with all the trimmings, rice, beans, onions, tomatoes, etc., and a combo desert of flan and double layer fudge cake which was to die for).  Thank you El Segundo Sol!!  You made my sons 30th Birthday an exception dinning experience.  We would highly recommend dinning at  El Segundo Sol if you are in Las Vegas! Thanks again El Segundo Sol Team, Vince.

NpjiMhilFwvFW7kfPweMmg.text: A group of 30+ of us wanted somewhere on the strip to gather for dinner. Kori at El Segundo Sol did an AMAZING job of organizing it for us. We had a perfectly sized private room, were able to order off the full menu (every other restaurant wanted us to pick from a $65 per person ++ fixed menu), and paying the check was a breeze. Great service and surprisingly great food-- I expected it to be your typical Mexican cuisine, but it was delicious, and moderately priced for the strip. Huge drinks menu as well, which was a winner for our group.   I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for somewhere to take a group-- and Kori is super helpful!

bBa0_IQkASF8Z9zF0uM1tA.text: This is my favorite place for a big frozen margarita !  The margarita is soo good and with just one of the big ones you are good to go !  They have awesome guacamole and chips and salsa.  The ambiance and the music are great !  I had the special of the day which was an enchilada platter.  The enchilada was good and the cilantro rice was excellent.  The prices are a little high and it is not 100% authentic but overall this place is great.

3Xq74Rc2jG3CeuaFHYPl_g.text: Food and drinks are good but not cheap. $64 for two small pitchers of sangria. The customer service is great and there's a good atmosphere, just make sure to bring a $100 plus for a good meal.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uKkZKAyvzo-KNJnXugU-jQ.text: I came here because I had a gift card from my time share. The service wasn't terrible but it was ridiculously slow. I am not over exaggerating when I say we were waiting 20+ minutes for everything. 20 minutes to get water. 30 minutes to get our appetizer. 30 minutes to get our entree after our appetizer was done. 20 minutes until our server came back with the check and another 20 until he grabbed the check back for us to pay. We were there for two hours and 90% of that time was spent waiting. The food is very mediocre. For being so high priced they don't have many options. To start I had an elote which was the most bland, basic and unauthentic one I've ever had. There was barely anything on it. For my entree I had the beef enchilada. Nothing special and no stand out flavors. It wasn't terrible but the meat just tasted cold and old, like leftovers. Either they didn't serve it fresh or they just keep their beef sitting out. The atmosphere is nice on the inside and outside. Also it is not inside the fashion show mall, you have to walk outside to get to it.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef enchilada.
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My barely flavored elote

2B_go4yJuFFgGPQspGRwnw.text: Erica was great!!! 4 of us went to happy hour and Erica took great care of us.  She recommended things and gave us advice on how to order.  Everything she recommended was great.  And the guacamole-WOW! I would recommend El Segundo Sol.  Just remember to ask for Erica.

c5MW4GUsI9Dix6spsK5ysw.text: I was really surprised by this place actually. I thought I wasn't going to get good tacos but I was so wrong!  Everything from the guac to the tacos were so good. The salsas don't have a lot of spice to it so watch out for that. Definitely recommend the Baja fish tacos, and the pork belly tacos. Wow, so much flavor! Their happy hour is awesome, and the ambience is so nice. Located in the fashion show mall right next to kona grill and ra sushi

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guac
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area- only area HH is available

cMt6uSoCCJtw3Tsp5NdjoQ.text: Group of 20, forced to do fixed menu.  Took staff 1.5 hours just to bring out a DIY burrito platter.  Two hours spent and I ended up with one sub par burrito.  Now looking for something else to eat somewhere else...

q3oLOtZGCL4DmModT9ayVg.text: The absolute best Mexican food on the strip!!! Elotes for an appetizer with chips and their tacos and fajitas are amazing!

stOM8kvinzZaRSMONWzkIw.text: The drinks were really good. I had a pear margarita which I loved. My husband and I shared a chicken fajita dish which was okay. We also ordered the guacamole that was a favorite item and it was pretty amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BbSvPpzlg3sZmKN6M4skPA.text: Went there on August 2014 and ordered Mexican Pizza. The next time I ordered the taco and the works plate, it was okay.

_5TqD_MOaGS0NJcwFvOz8g.text: We had lunch (or tried to) the waiter was just over whelmed.  Could not bring two ice teas at the same time.  Asked five times for an extra napkin before finally got one.  One entree was barely warm and was told they could not reheat it.  Overall never to return!!!!!!!

2OWCVkFQh9KBXfavKTRi1Q.text: So so soooooo good. We visited from L.A. a couple of weeks ago and I am seriously regretting not asking what was in those fantastic braised beef tacos. Usually when we visit Vegas, we like to try a new restaurant each time, but we will definitely go back for seconds at Segundo Sol.

tcnrUk-rMJSG-I32zv9pAQ.text: My friend invited me to Vegas for my birthday. She booked a reservation to El Segundo Sol. We got free chips and salsa via a special text (FYI- free chips and salsa refills).  We ordered guacamole as well, but it was too spicy. Suzanne, the floor manager for the evening was very accommodating. She gave use New guacamole and even threw in some tres leche cake for my birthday!  Our waitress Erica, was pretty awesome as well. She suggested some great spots to go to for our visit. The food was really good. My friend had the Baja fish tacos and I had the chicken tacos. The tacos are cute because it's not assembled for you, you can assemble your own tacos. The tortillas were handmade and delicious. If you're looking for a friendly, fun environment, this is the place to go. Don't forget to get the giant margaritas!!! 4 ounces of alcohol

ZIyKHp-1HsjTIwGRaTFZlg.text: Great happy hour, excellent menu.  Bartender accidentally dropped a container behind a counter - without missing a beat it went right into the dishwasher.  Someone that cares about doing it right.  Very friendly and helpful staff too.  Don't waste your time with Senior Frogs . . .

wLx0aadtCb48BeA3iWuaiw.text: Yessss!  Our favorite spot in Vegas for Mexican food, drinks and HH. We crushed our normal fresh made guacamole and endless chips and salsa.   We've eaten here over 10 times now and drive out of our way and park at the fashion island mall parking center.  Or if we're staying at the Wynn, Trump towers or Venetian we walk on over.   They have indoor/outdoor seating with a lot of bar seating and tv's. Our favorites include the typical Mexican subjects - any of their tacos and fajitas are killer good.   Check out the rewards program they have with lettuce entertain you.   This time around Z hooked us up with 5-star Service.   Thank you!

jjkWcNiDfqzzPGpt51IaQQ.text: Delicious dining and the happy hour is great. I like the prickly pear margaritas, the guacamole, and the tres leches cake. Nice atmosphere.

i7vdjW1HPwP3NUfAm1VncQ.text: Love most items on the menu. Sitting by the bar is a great way to people watch. The freshly made guacamole is hands down one of the best. All the servers and bartenders are very nice. I consider them a Mexican Bistro with a twist. Love the tacos, meat, fish, seafood were all great. The sweet corn tamales were a great surprise and delicious. Elote corn and taquitoes are also so good. Fajitas use great quality meats. The drinks are always delicious. Only warning.... sitting under the trees is dangerous cuz of bird poop.

0uExVPkpakWVPwyrXEI3lQ.text: Came here after a long day exploring the Las Vegas strip and was not disappointed. The hosts were kind and seated us right away. Our waiter was friendly and served us quickly. We had the chips and salsa and I must say the green salsa was so good as well as the red one. We also tried the beef quesadilla and the chicken taquitos. I can't say much about the taquitos since I did not try them, but the presentation was good. As for the quesadilla, that was the best beef I've ever had in any Mexican restaurant. It was extremely tender and the flavor was wonderful. I highly recommend this dish if you aren't feeling too hungry since it is actually an appetizer. The reason it is 4/5 stars is because even though the staff was really friendly, the waiter did not ask if we wanted any more water and just came to clear our table at different times. Overall, I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken taquitos
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef quesadilla
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mural of bullfighters

TC-koTtweAigl0v6nWj2sQ.text: I don't want to rip this place but when you are paying high dollar for food, you expect more (I don't mean quantity).  Margarita was good (had the frozen strawberry) but the salad (salty), nachos (drizzled with cheese sauce) made it forgettable.  Scenery and decor is nice.

VLLttGjaDzQBxQ_EfRlf7A.text: Food was delicious & the service was superb! Great staff! Very friendly & accommodating!! They did everything they could to serve our large party. 6 stars out of 5 stars!

zQvMgtukSdP9vu2nE-MBXw.text: Awesome awesome Mexican restaurant. I recommend eating in the bar area. Being seated in the bar area, at first I was very iffie, but you know the service was very good.  I will be coming back  to this restaurant when I return to Vegas.   Don't ask for the hottest salsa! Cuz man it burnt our tongues.  You know what it is?  It's those ghost peppers.  It looked like the color of newborn baby poop.  People will like it but even the waiter said he wouldn't eat it because it was soooo hot. It made my sister cry because of how hot it was.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Faijata
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada tacos

4DMdw_2iDEgBnGflGe6OhQ.text: Angela was great! We sat in the bar area and she noticed we hadn't been helped and immediately stopped to help us out, even if we weren't in her section! She was kind, knowledgeable, and incredibly attentive. The food was great but the service is what really made the experience great. Thanks Angela!

ShBitUbmP7LM2SykAzqK4g.text: Probably the best value happy hour on the strip. Homemade tortillas, meat filled street tacos that are so damn full o' goodness that you won't believe it. Chips with 3 different salsas that all taste fresh and yummy.   Fabulous cocktails and enough other cool details to keep you here for a long time without spending a fortune. You'll be stuffed from happy hour, and ready to hit the town without hesitation. It's waaaaaay down at fashion show mall, so it can be a hike if you're not staying at that end. Get a membership with their parent company - Lettuce Entertain You. You'll get points on their app, and get more money back and just eat your way through the strip for days upon days. See my review on Eiffel Tower Restaurant- same group! You'll get rewards and more food!

NjQviQAqjc66TWLpWAFbcQ.text: Unfortunately a dining experience that just left me feeling like I wasted money.   It took almost 10 minutes to get water or have any attention from the waiter once we were sat.   The drink order was incorrect. The food order was incorrect. (Ordered enchiladas, came out with tacos).  They gave my partner a free drink I guess. But by the time our food came out an hour and fifteen minutes after being sat, neither of us were hungry anymore.   Perhaps the importance of service needs to be reiterated to the staff. Oh well.

Ot4zzHxabj-YMOwX37D9pA.text: Strong drinks, delicious food, and wonderful service--what more could you ask for?   We had Claudia as our server, and she made our first meal in Vegas one to remember. She was extremely kind and tentative, so make sure to ask for her  As for the food and drinks--both a 10/10. We ordered taco platters and recommend the carne asada and pork. Again, the drinks are strong and filled with fresh fruit without being overly sugary or filled with syrup.   All in all, El Segundo is a must!

XEE6RMBJ7XEopRhkjwi4oQ.text: I go here very often but not enough to be known by name. I love their happy hour from 4-7pm everyday. Yes, everyday! They use to have pretty big tacos but recently,  they are super small for happy hour . I go for the blended margaritas and the quesadilla on happy hour. They seem to be the only happy hour place that still makes blended margaritas. My favorite flavor is the mango. They offered me the white sangria and it was amazing! Come for the food but you will stay for the drinks. The food is just ok. I suggest going to Strip Burger next door because it's the same company but the food is better.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Sangria
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small happy hour taco
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen Mango margarita

KoDEsUJXB_HLY6Nqwbq_1g.text: Super friendly service and they have pimientos de Padron, which I hadn't had since Spain. The fajitas were also fantastic with meat that was juicy and flavorful. We also scarfed down the freshly made guacamole with house-made salsa. Honestly, we weren't expecting this restaurant to be good since it looked a bit touristy but the food and the service blew us away.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Fresh - Made Guacamole
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Peppers (Pimientos de Padron)

hJlWabc2lQMD3CTgAInYAw.text: Great happy hr deals, so we decided to rest from all the walking and site seeing in Vegas! Seated and given menus, the waitress was kind and explained the daily specials. Lots of seating and people jus enjoyin the evening. Our order came out fairly quickly, we only ordered drinks. The drinks were tasty and not watered down.  Next time Im in town, I will try the food. From all the great reviews Im sure it will be good! It was great to to take a break and chill in a nice relaxing atmosphere.  Located on the strip you cant wont cant miss it, around the corner from The Sugar Factory.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8qfc0_U4Z9S2U6tf5q9FMg.text: We are staying at the Encore and wanted to find good food without the crazy increased prices. This place was recommended to us by a lady that frequents Vegas. It did not disappoint! They have a DAILY happy hour with drinks, tacos, loaded nachos and quesadillas. Our frozen margarita was not watered down (we've found this to be a problem on the strip).  Food was delicious and service was great. I'm going back today for another frozen margarita. The only negative is that their margarita on the rocks is not fresh the way I like it and is a bit too sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi taco
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos with chicken added
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef quesadilla

Z9vmby0An2arJPMkP1-I4Q.text: Really enjoyed my meal here!  We started with the guacamole which was so delicious we did fill up on it.  For dinner I had the braised beef tacos with rice and beans and my friend had the mahi mahi and chicken mixed fajitas.  We both thought they were great.  Our waiter was so nice and accommodating as well.  For drinks I had the white and the red sangria.  I preferred the white.  My friend had a strawberry margarita and she really liked it as well.  Would definitely return next visit to Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Sangria
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Beef Tacos
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Sangria and strawberry margarita

cM2fgzktYFa3Q7Y3Ku2luw.text: This has been the best Mexican food we have tried In Vegas!!! The food tasted so fresh down to the fresh guacamole and sour cream. Our server Martin was super amazing!!! And informative! He def knows how to hold down a convo and is very professional and friendly! Def ask for him if you come here!!! We ordered chicken tacos and steak fajitas and elote and fresh guacamole. To die for!!$ very flavorful food and the ambiance is beautiful. Will def come back here again :)

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak fajitas
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eli te
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh - Made Guacamole

5pqF4P4I4vc6DomyduLvhQ.text: The happy hour is fantastic here. The ambiance is just as amazing. And the service is great!  They have heaters outside in the winter to keep you warm and misters in the summer to keep you chilled. The music is really good too!  People watching is fantastic at this location as some of the seating is positioned toward Las Vegas Blvd. Be warned, you'll see some interesting things.  Overall a great place and if you park at the mall it's free parking.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour

2S_jzz9mmkGoipe2947BNg.text: "Trash" doesn't begin to explain how bad this place is. The service is the worst I have ever experienced. A friend of mine who is confined to a wheel chair was forced to wheel through a restaurant (that definitely isn't wheelchair accessible) to the bar to show her ID because the bartender refused to come to her and accommodate her needs. TRASH PERSON. He also refused to let us start a tab, and treated us like plebeians even though we bought several drinks and tipped well. SOGGY TRASH PERSON. Not only was the bartender trash, but we also ordered food, and after they brought us the wrong order, we were forced to wait 40 minutes to get the dishes we actually ordered.   Basically, if you're looking for a horrible time, love being discriminated against for being less-able-bodied, and genuinely hate your life....El Segundo Sol is the place for you!!

9Zr_26Oj1YLOaKB2XjtYJQ.text: The food was okay but the SERVICE was TERRIBLE. The guy who took our order never came back. We had to go grab a pitcher of water from the bar to refill our own glasses. I would avoid if your thinking of dining.

3tKfPolDGxOSrXlhNt7qFw.text: *** DO NOT DINE AT THIS RESTAURANT***  I came here with some friends to have dinner. Get sat down and what is next to us, one extremely drunk guy and a female who is high on some kind of drug. Thinking ok yeah this is Vegas so I'll let it go for now... Well just when i think things are getting better, the guy begins throwing up projectile vomit on the ground which was splashing on at least three other tables which too were filled with guests. Then the lady falls out of her chair and passes out. The 2 managers & 4 restaurant workers rushed to her aid and then called for security. Five minutes later security arrives and tried to talk both out of not having the ambulance come check them out.. Then after he "spoke" to someone, the ambulance was called. Two other 5+ person parties actually moved their table on their own to somewhere else so they would not have to be near the drunk/high people.   Both managers still had no care in the world to even acknowledge anyone near these people to show any care in the world about what was going on right next to us. Then to make matters worse, the security guy comes to our table while we are eating and tells all four of us to move our table over so the medics can squeeze in and load these people onto stretchers. (Mind you, there was ample room through the main entrance to bring the stretcher in and do what they needed to do.) After both people were taken away on stretchers due to their levels of intoxication, the staff still made no meantion of apologizing about anything that went on. After all was done, my buddy had to ask the waitress for a box due to being nauseous from the throw up. The waitress' reply... "yeah I understand, here's your box." Still no acknowledgement of the incident that went on less then 5 feet from us. So to bring this to an end, we paid our bill and got out of that restaurant as fast as we could. Just to add one more wonderful thing, the powdery substance they put on the floor to absorb the throwup, was still sitting in the floor 30 minutes after being thrown down   This place has no care for their customers and the managers would rather watch sports tv on the other side of the bar then to make an appearance to the paying customers who had to sit through this event. We will never step foot into this place again.   They only got a "1" star because it doesn't allow me to give "0" stars.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Throw up that has yet to be cleaned up after 30 minutes.

QvW3tCX9Q4KQu-jvgwmC8A.text: Came for lunch, the Nachos are totally sharable and delicous! Got seated right away and the food came quick.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good value for the nachos!

lM8v4_BlmhCTZo_KsbJ3Nw.text: The only reason I'm giving three stars is because the service was great and the manager was very nice.  The food in the other hand was horrendous.  We ordered beef enchiladas and ahi tuna ceviche.  The ahi tuna ceviche was extremely sour, my eyes squinted at every bite.  I HAD to pair it with chips that came in a small cup because I just couldn't eat it plain.   The beef enchiladas came and my mom took the first bite and said "uh oh, it's dry and bitter". I tried it and spit it out. It was VERY bitter.  We told the waiter and he got the manager.  The manager was very nice about the situation and wanted us to give something else a try.  At this point we were very hungry and disappointed, so we said no thank you and went else where.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J57WCNQicdZEIgSmm3-KgA.text: Excellent happy hour specials and conveniently located on the strip.  We stopped through here to see what they had to offer for happy hour specials. The staff was very courtesy and professional when we arrived. Our waitress was very attentive and very friendly. The restrooms are male and female and was very clean. We decided to only drink since we had already ate lunch some where previously.  I would visit them again and will recommend them to friends and family members.

6Ko-_mhb5dhWwJgJjKe24A.text: Service was cool but the food...I ordered the carne asada tacos, I'm not going to lie, it was beautiful cuts of meat but the taste was super bland...my girlfriend ordered the Baja fish tacos...food wasn't cooked all the way...she instantly got food poisoning...

sSnozbsW9CTKx0p1sePyvA.text: Really enjoyed this spot to eat on the strip! Easy access at the Fashion Show mall and next to strip burger. The service was excellent and the food was really good. Of course the prices are higher on the strip, but not overly priced. Really enjoyed the service as our server did a great job with explaining ingredients inside the dishes and helping me with choices on the menu based on my food allergies. I ordered the chicken fajitas.. bomb.com! Some of the best I've had and unique set up which I enjoyed. My friends got the port tacos and quesadilla. Both enjoyed. Overall great spot and will be back if I find myself in this area again!

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Quesadilla
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Tacos
Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fajitas

0S-rJ3f6KPFX8IvAc_1_-w.text: Brought a friend for Margaritas and Guacamole & Chips. After looking at the menu we ordered the Casamigos Margarita. Tequila, Lime Juice and Agave Nectar. While watching the Bartender make the second round I noticed her putting drops of something other than the listed ingredients. After checking to see what she put in the Margaritas, it turned out to be Stevia.  Thats wrong on so many levels. I ended up getting nausea and throwing up. Beware of what you are getting. Its not always as it seems.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Added to Margaritas and not listed as part of the Drink

_8V3SOr4RqknUXdjbfKWQA.text: Expected touristy.  Not so much or as bad. Expected average food.  Not at all. Definitely way better than I expected.  First of all, the patio is quite divine.  Made to feel outdoors even though it's on the outside of a mall patio.  Really nice.  On a Saturday night about 630pm, we were seated right away with our reservation -- but it wasn't needed.  Lots of tables were available, likely because it was happy hour time and it's apparently good, so the bar was packed.  1.  Chips & Salsa [$free, 4.5 stars] -- Totally and completely delicious. Wonderfully warm, thin, and not oily chips & 3 types of salsas that are worth fighting for.  2.  Guacamole [$11.95, 5.0 stars] -- served in a large and traditional molcajete bowl, a good amount -- probably 2 avocados worth.  3.  Slow-braised Pork Tacos [$16.95, 4.5 stars] -- a make-your-own taco bar, excellent carnitas, rice, and beans.  Loved.  Overall, my gf loved her Mahi Mahi Tacos, and her daughter loved the Shrimp Fajitas which made it a complete love-fest.  Even though our server was so very nice and fun, my rating drops a star; not efficient, forgetful, and slow.

photos.caption: Photo of El Segundo Sol - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slow-braised Pork Tacos [$16.95, 4.5 stars] -- a make-your-own taco bar

bFcXM7Bl4N7vf8djf6DSew.text: The 3 star could and should have easily been four + stars had it not been for the 10 minute lag time just to be served water without an "I apologize for the wait" greeting( or any greeting for that matter). Served warm water, placed our order. Our server arrived with all but the shot I requested, so waited again for that to come. Had an awesome complimentary guacamole that was served in a generously sized mortar. The server who presented it even apologized for the wait, although there was none!  Tasted fresh, flavourful, authentic. I had the chipotle chicken Caesar salad, my companion had the quesadilla. She preferred my salad, quesadilla not worth anything above $5.  Cold, small and boring.  Had to ask for more salsa, more margarita as server chose to pay more attention to other tables around us, even walking by w/out acknowledging us. So inattentive, in fact, after a long wait of inactivity, I had to get up, walk over to whom I assume may have been a manager( no greeting from him to know otherwise) and asked for the check so I could pay and leave. This is when the server decided to catch us to act like we left too soon! Yet she paid no attention when we were seating at her station waiting, staring, waiting. I had to get up to get the check. So unnoticed we were, we could have walked out without any regard( or paying). It was only because I asked this guy for the check that he realized the situation. Second time here was subpar service. Subpar.

9mZHEx01HP_IPCjoAczi2g.text: The most flavorful Mexican meal I can recall from the salsa to the guac down to the sauces on the enchiladas and fish tacos.  Expensive margaritas!! 7 oz for $8 plain on the rocks. However, the server went to a neighboring sister restaurant to grab me a much needed cider. Amazing.  Also had excellent kids' menus which were non greasy and with healthy options and vegetarian friendly. Rice and beans were a side but flavored like a main dish w fresh herbs and ample spices putting this place well above their peers.  Owned by Lettuce Entertain You a Chicago holding group but you would NEVER know.  Salsa has to be made fresh daily with premium ingredients. They have a frequent diner program.  Great for a date, drinks and families this place has it all.

5bCyhiOV8Cu9-FlfEfkkTg.text: Felipe & Chris are great bartenders especially when it comes to the margaritas!!!!! The nachos are a great snack as well! This place is a great start to drinking on the strip for sure.

GbbgqylQa3OpA7tSdWY4Hg.text: Living in chicago I know all about lettuce entertain you restaurants.  They usually have quality food served in a hip atmosphere.  The restaurant is located in a shopping center so you won't have all the craziness found near some of the hotels.  Outdoor seating is a plus.
